reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Promoting more safe, secure and accessible protection environment for crisis affected and at risk "MWBG" especially new IDPs, through enhancing access to quality protection interventions in Dana, and Marret-Tamsrin sub-districts

description.narrative:
MWL has designed this project based on the emergency situation in the northwest of Syria, to respond to protection concerns for ‘MWBG’ with high severity of needs, in a comprehensive and complementary approach. Project activities cover 4 protection sub-clusters: CP, GBV, GP, and MA, targeting to address the most immediate gaps and critical needs of the newly displaced in 8 communities(Sarmada, Hezri-Deir Hassan-Kafr Deryan -Kafrehmul-Haranbush-Hazano-Kelly) in Dana and Marret-Tamsrin sub-districts, Activities will be implemented through an emergency response model aim to scale up and complement the ongoing response. The Project will include the following protection services: 1- - Provide individual protection assistance for 550 of most vulnerable and at-risk, especially recent IDPs, to provide a set of one-time (non-periodic) assistance to families or children identified according to eligibility criteria. IPA will support provision of relocation through safe and voluntary transportation and associated protective package for people to move safely from hostilities to safe destinations. 2- Establish 2 multi-sectoral referral pathways and service mapping in the targeted locations, and conduct 800 referrals for most vulnerable and at risk " MWBG" (protection and non-protection), and 150 of at-risk women and girls to specialized services 3- Establish a Help desk for sharing information, in targeted locations of the 8 communities in Dana and Marret-Tamsrin sub-districts, and provide supportive information and advice about services during emergencies for 15000 of girls, boys, women, and men 4- by mobile outreach activities in these tents 5- Provide structured, sustained protection programs, (PSS) in the protection community center for (1560) ‘MWBG’ 6- Provide protection services including referral activities for 200 of girls, boys, women, and men living with disabilities 7- Conduct PFA, and/or non-structured PSS, for 12000 girls, boys, women, of most vulnerable and at-risk, especially recent IDPs affected by the crisis, through the mobile teams 8- Provide awareness-raising sessions for 7500 people reached through mobile teams on protection risks, avoidance, remedies/available protective services, and awareness on risk education for 18000 of ‘MWBG’, and awareness messages on CP for 7500 ‘MWBG’ 9- Distribute 5000 dignity kits for displaced women and girls 10- Provide GBV prevention activities (awareness – FGD sessions, etc) for 3150 ‘MWBG’ 11- Support existing protection community networks in targeted locations to create 16 community-based initiatives conducted to prevent and respond to protection concerns especially for new IDPs 12- Contribute to protection monitoring efforts by active participating in PMTF, and conduct protection monitoring in 4 communities in Dana and Marret-Tamsrin sub-districts
Project services will deliver be through 2 main interventions: 1- Expanding the capacity of MWL's community protection center in Dana to provide a space enabling staff to engage in delivering equitable, quality, inclusive, age-appropriate protection services. 2- Expansion the outreach activities through 8 mobile outreach teams to cover more communities and reach individuals in smaller and informal IDP sites and other essential points in Dana, and Marret-Tamsrin (targeted in collaboration with the CCCM cluster, CP Monitoring Group, and PMTF).
MWL will benefit from its current protection projects (with SCHF and UNICEF) in Dana, and Marret-Tamsrin, to get support amp carry out referrals to the specialized services. Furthermore, MWL developed the project with a strong risk management strategy, and propose a suitable ‘plan B’ in line with the allocation strategy and risk analysis contained in NW Syria Humanitarian Readiness and Response Plan, due to the high context volatility, MWL has a good access and existence in Idleb and Aleppo governorates, with protection projects in Afrin, Al-Bab, Idleb, Harim districts.

owner-org.narrative: United Nations OCHA Financial Tracking Service (UN OCHA FTS)
